title: Emmerdale fans are left 'in tears' as Robert and Aaron go on the run after rapist Lee dies
text:

Emmerdale fans were left heartbroken following tonight's episode of the soap.

Viewers took to Twitter after the hour-long show to reveal their emotions towards the end of 'Robron' - as Robert Sugden and Aaron Dingle went on the run following rapist Lee Posner's shock death.

During the episode, a petrified Victoria told her brother that nasty rapist Lee died in hospital from the injuries sustained in Robert's brutal attack.

Panic set in as Robert realised he could be charged with Lee's murder and Liv suggests that he should go on the run with her brother Aaron.

Robert and Aaron realise it is the only way they can be together and decide they must leave the village immediately.

Social media was awash with complaints from fans venting their devastation over the sequence of events.

(Image: ITV)

Leading the troops, one wrote: "Robron know they are a mess without each other they are each others whole world."

Another shared: "Poor Robert he is so scared Robert and Aaron are so scared this is heartbreaking."

"I can't handle never seeing Robert again, felt so despair watching the end."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Many of Emmerdale viewers were left in tears as the emotional scenes played out on screens.

One wrote: "These episodes are going to break me.. I can’t stop crying after that episode and we haven’t even seen the worst of it yet."

"That was the HARDEST thing I’ve ever watched.. I’m absolutely devastated, can’t stop crying!"

Robert actor Ryan Hawley recently spoke out about his "emotional goodbye" from the soap.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

He said of the death twist: "The news has just been broken to them so they haven’t really got a plan, they are going to have to take it as it comes.

"It means some very emotional goodbyes to some people in the village, but they have to be quick and there are some people they don’t even get the chance to because there just isn’t time.

"The police are literally on their way so they have to be fast and quickly make it out of the village. They really believe they are going to stay on the run and make it work. There were very emotional goodbyes with a real sense of urgency."

Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV, with an extra episode airing on Thursdays at 8pm.
description: Viewers have fled to Twitter to declare how heartbroken they are following the husbands' departure
